channel.title: Google Flu
channel.description:
We've found that certain search terms are good indicators of flu activity. Google Flu Trends uses aggregated Google search data to estimate flu activity
So they're taking the search frequency of various keywords and determining "flu activity". Canada: http://www.google.org/flutrends/intl/en_us/ca/ US: http://www.google.org/flutrends/intl/en_us/us/ pretty kul

item.title: Google Flu
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:7, topic:307410”]Just as update of this: http://www.google.org/flutrends/intl/en_us/ca/#CA

I find it fucking hilarious how hyped up the media was about this, and how quickly it died. Nothing out of the ordinary I suppose.

ps I didn’t get vaccinated, and I never got it.[/quote]
that spike is exactly when i got it, novemberish

Read full topic

item.title: Google Flu
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:307410”]On the US one you can clearly see that the states near Mexico are “ill” just because of swine flu outbreak.

Why does it have the flu trends for all these random countries, but none for the UK?[/quote]they want to help track swine flu for countries they care about

lulz

Read full topic
